furniture@rome.name: furniture
furniture@rome.examine:
You hope to eventually be able to own a piece of furniture just like these
someday.  These are only dreams, of course.

longswordh@rome.name: longswordh
longswordh@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
longswordh@rome.desc[0]: An ordinary looking longsword lies here.

vendors@rome.name: vendors
vendors@rome.examine:
There are several sidewalk vendors here, selling fresh fruits and vegetables,
home baked goods, fine jewelry and other items.  Most of the items for sale are
of very high quality.

quencheda@rome.name: quencheda
quencheda@rome.desc[0]: Caesar's quenched sword has been left here.

kodarta@rome.name: kodarta
kodarta@rome.desc[0]: The Kodarta staff has been carelessly left here.

peach@rome.name: peach
peach@rome.examine:
You see nothing special.

Or.. wait a minute.. what's that button doing there?
Oh.. you were mistaken. It's an ordinary peach. *sigh*
peach@rome.desc[0]: A pink and yellow peach is just waiting to be picked up and eaten.

shielda@rome.name: shielda
shielda@rome.examine: You see nothing special. Absolutely nothing.
shielda@rome.desc[0]: A small, iron shield is gathering dust.

sandalsj@rome.name: sandalsj
sandalsj@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

stream@rome.name: stream
stream@rome.examine:
A stream of the clearest, cleanest water that you have ever seen winds its way
through the valley.

sandalsc@rome.name: sandalsc
sandalsc@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

hole@rome.name: hole
hole@rome.examine:
You walk over to the hole and see that there is a large turd floating in a
pool black water about 2 feet below the surface of the ground.  As you lean
closer to get a better look, your nose catches a concentrated dose of the
fragrant aroma wafting upwards.  Your stomach decides that it has had enough
of this shoddy treatment and you puke until it is empty.

laundry@rome.name: laundry
laundry@rome.examine: It smells of sweat and is covered with mud.

sandalsp@rome.name: sandalsp
sandalsp@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

stand@rome.name: stand
stand@rome.examine:
You see large wooden structures that are designed to separate the judge, jury
and witnesses from the rest of the courtroom.  They are made of polished
oak and are strictly functional.

nroad@rome.name: nroad
nroad@rome.examine: The road is wide and very muddy.

shieldd@rome.name: shieldd
shieldd@rome.examine: You see nothing special. Absolutely nothing.
shieldd@rome.desc[0]: A small, iron shield is gathering dust.

shieldi@rome.name: shieldi
shieldi@rome.examine: You see nothing special. Absolutely nothing.
shieldi@rome.desc[0]: A small, iron shield is gathering dust.

fish@rome.name: fish
fish@rome.examine: A variety of species swims peacefully in the cool, clear water.

platform@rome.name: platform
platform@rome.examine:
********************************************
         *                                          *
         *      The Roman Aqueduct and Mountain     *
         *           Observation Platform           *
         *                                          *
         *       Designed and built by the Froboz   *
         *            Magic Platform Company        *
         *                                          *
         ********************************************

pendant@rome.name: pendant
pendant@rome.desc[0]: A beautiful jade pendant has been left here.

mace@rome.name: mace
mace@rome.examine:
A typical weapon for one who tortures people: you would die very slowly,
indeed, if hit with this weapon.
mace@rome.desc[0]: The executioner's mace is lying here.

pewter@rome.name: pewter
pewter@rome.desc[0]: There is a pewter ring lying here.

wgate@rome.name: wgate
wgate@rome.examine:
The gate has been permanently rusted shut and is further secured by a large
chain and padlock.  Don't even bother THINKING about trying to open it.

pencils@rome.name: pencils
pencils@rome.examine:
An ordinary number 2 lead pencil.  Judging by the teeth marks on the shaft, the
user should see a dentist very soon!

double@rome.name: double
double@rome.desc[0]: A double sided key has been left here.

sandalsl@rome.name: sandalsl
sandalsl@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

hairpin@rome.name: hairpin
hairpin@rome.desc[0]: A woman's hairpin is lying here.

dogb@rome.name: dogb
dogb@rome.desc[0]: A hotdog loaded with chili and onions has been left here.

sandalsd@rome.name: sandalsd
sandalsd@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

banana@rome.name: banana
banana@rome.examine: Aren't you going to eat it?
banana@rome.desc[0]: A large banana lies on the ground.

seal@rome.name: seal
seal@rome.examine: The seal of the emperor is mounted above the judge's stand.

mountain@rome.name: mountain
mountain@rome.examine:
Off to the southwest, you can see  a huge mountain that is partially obscured
by the haze.  It is rumored that the gods reside there and protect the city.

cashbox@rome.name: cashbox
cashbox@rome.examine:
It's a shame that the exchange rate for Roman money is so low.  What amounts
to a fortune in Rome isn't even worth one gold coin.  The contents of the box
add up to about .... well forget it.  It isn't worth your time or trouble to
carry it around.

orangea@rome.name: orangea
orangea@rome.desc[0]: A sun-ripened orange has been left here.

steel@rome.name: steel
steel@rome.desc[0]: A steel key is lying on the ground.

shieldb@rome.name: shieldb
shieldb@rome.examine: You see nothing special. Absolutely nothing.
shieldb@rome.desc[0]: A small, iron shield is gathering dust.

trail@rome.name: trail
trail@rome.examine: The path is a little muddy, possibly due to a recent thundershower.

aquamarine@rome.name: aquamarine
aquamarine@rome.desc[0]: There is an aquamarine colored key here.

strawberries@rome.name: strawberries
strawberries@rome.desc[0]: Ah, strawberries! You didn't see those in Boondocks before.

statue@rome.name: statue
statue@rome.examine:
A larger than life stone statue of Caligula, the Mad Emperor looks at you. It
looks like it is holding a phallus.

sapphire@rome.name: sapphire
sapphire@rome.desc[0]: A sapphire ring has been left here.

longswordc@rome.name: longswordc
longswordc@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
longswordc@rome.desc[0]: An ordinary looking longsword lies here.

helmet@rome.name: helmet
helmet@rome.desc[0]: A Roman combat helmet has been left here.

aquaduct@rome.name: aquaduct
aquaduct@rome.examine:
To the southeast, off in the distance, stands a large stone structure that is
used to channel water into the city.

sandalsk@rome.name: sandalsk
sandalsk@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

longswordl@rome.name: longswordl
longswordl@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
longswordl@rome.desc[0]: An ordinary looking longsword lies here.

slimeb@rome.name: slimeb
slimeb@rome.examine:
Due to the availability of moisture and nutrients, a green, viscous slime has
grown and covered the everything with a slippery coating.  It seems to go out
of its way to drip on you.

longsworda@rome.name: longsworda
longsworda@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
longsworda@rome.desc[0]: An ordinary looking longsword lies here.

tempered@rome.name: tempered
tempered@rome.desc[0]: A nasty looking tempered sword is lying here.

cinders@rome.name: cinders
cinders@rome.examine:
The ashes are a very fine grayish white powder that seems to be the only
worldly remains of Froboz's 'test specimens'.

line@rome.name: line
line@rome.examine: The lines are very long and people look impatient.

plywood@rome.name: plywood
plywood@rome.examine:
Rome was written by Onivel of JediMUD in the spring of 1992.  It was
originally debugged and tested on Renaissance DikuMUD and then ported to
CircleMUD and finally JediMUD.  I would like to sincerely thank the following
people who gave invaluable help in the design and construction of this area:

 Rasmussen of CircleMUD  -- for idea to write Rome in the first place and for
                            advice with coding Roman god routines.

 Destiny of Apocalypse   -- for encouragement, proofreading, help in refining
                            the area concept and allowing me to put my first 
                            area on her MUD.

 Miranda, Romulus, Ikee, and all the others who assisted with balance, bugs
 and typo eradication, or just had a good time here.

 Thanks.
   -Onivel

 ***  This zone was ported to DIRT 3.0 for Boondocks AberMUD  ***
 ***  by Zarniwoop (zarn@rugrcx.rug.nl), October 1993         ***
plywood@rome.desc[0]: There is a plywood sign bolted to the wall here.

wand@rome.name: wand
wand@rome.examine:
You can't figure out what its purpose is. You could ask Froboz, but he's
dead now. Too bad.
wand@rome.desc[0]: There is a prototype of a new magical wand lying here.

traila@rome.name: traila
traila@rome.examine: The mountain trail is a little muddy, due to the recent rains.

swordsa@rome.name: swordsa
swordsa@rome.examine:
Titus has enough hardware in here to outfit a large army.  Maybe that's why
he has a lucrative contract to sell weapons to the emperor's armies for
outrageous prices.

mustyx@rome.name: mustyx
mustyx@rome.examine: Memo to myself: Check out Brutus. He is behaving very strange lately.
mustyx@rome.desc[0]: A musty scroll has been dropped here.

sandalsr@rome.name: sandalsr
sandalsr@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

shieldc@rome.name: shieldc
shieldc@rome.examine: You see nothing special. Absolutely nothing.
shieldc@rome.desc[0]: A small, iron shield is gathering dust.

tomes@rome.name: tomes
tomes@rome.examine: The books are very large and filled with Roman legal precedent.

potion@rome.name: potion
potion@rome.desc[0]: There is a flask, containing a blaze orange potion, resting here.

boots@rome.name: boots
boots@rome.examine:
You'd look very cool in them. Whether they'd protect you from anything
is another matter entirely.
boots@rome.desc[0]: A pair of combat boots have been left here. They're very sturdy.

statues@rome.name: statues
statues@rome.examine: There is really nothing noteworthy about them.

sandalsa@rome.name: sandalsa
sandalsa@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

sandalsi@rome.name: sandalsi
sandalsi@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

diamond@rome.name: diamond
diamond@rome.desc[0]: A diamond studded key is sitting on the ground.

loincloth@rome.name: loincloth
loincloth@rome.desc[0]: Mar's red loincloth is resting here.

sandalsh@rome.name: sandalsh
sandalsh@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

sandalsb@rome.name: sandalsb
sandalsb@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

longswordg@rome.name: longswordg
longswordg@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
longswordg@rome.desc[0]: An ordinary looking longsword lies here.

sandalsq@rome.name: sandalsq
sandalsq@rome.desc[0]:
A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here, but they look more like
tennis shoes.

cells@rome.name: cells
cells@rome.examine:
You can see small and very cramped cells which are filthy.  You shiver and
vow to never do anything that would cause you to become a resident.

longswordk@rome.name: longswordk
longswordk@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
longswordk@rome.desc[0]: An ordinary looking longsword lies here.

documents@rome.name: documents
documents@rome.examine:
The documents are all written on reed scrolls made in Egypt and have been
sealed with wax.

structure@rome.name: structure
structure@rome.examine:
That would probably be the Coliseum.  There are a few good matches scheduled
for today.

weaponsa@rome.name: weaponsa
weaponsa@rome.examine: There are literally thousands of each.  Take your pick.

stethoscope@rome.name: stethoscope
stethoscope@rome.desc[0]: A doctor has left his stethoscope here.

shieldf@rome.name: shieldf
shieldf@rome.examine: You see nothing special. Absolutely nothing.
shieldf@rome.desc[0]: A small, iron shield is gathering dust.

shieldl@rome.name: shieldl
shieldl@rome.examine: You see nothing special. Absolutely nothing.
shieldl@rome.desc[0]: A small, iron shield is gathering dust.

onyx@rome.name: onyx
onyx@rome.desc[0]: An onyx ring has been left here.

thunderbolt@rome.name: thunderbolt
thunderbolt@rome.desc[0]: Jupiter's Thunderbolt has been left here.

bronze@rome.name: bronze
bronze@rome.desc[0]: There is a bronze belt sitting here.

winged@rome.name: winged
winged@rome.desc[0]: Mercury's winged sandals have been left here.

bracers@rome.name: bracers
bracers@rome.desc[0]: A pair of Moorish bracers has been dropped here.

flowers@rome.name: flowers
flowers@rome.examine: The plants contribute to a very relaxing atmosphere.

stone@rome.name: stone
stone@rome.examine:
You see a massive stone structure, built several centuries ago, that is used
to channel water into the city.

crystal@rome.name: crystal
crystal@rome.desc[0]: Someone has left the crystal Necklace of Knowledge here!

sandalsf@rome.name: sandalsf
sandalsf@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

shieldj@rome.name: shieldj
shieldj@rome.examine: You see nothing special. Absolutely nothing.
shieldj@rome.desc[0]: A small, iron shield is gathering dust.

ornate@rome.name: ornate
ornate@rome.examine:
It's about a powerful spell, which would turn strawberries into camels.
Apparently Froboz made this spell for a Dutch friend of his, an excentric
wizard with a bolar-hat.
ornate@rome.desc[0]: An ornate scroll has been left here.

sgate@rome.name: sgate
sgate@rome.examine: The gate appears to be closed and locked against intruders.

apple@rome.name: apple
apple@rome.desc[0]: A delicious looking apple has been left here.

longswordn@rome.name: longswordn
longswordn@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
longswordn@rome.desc[0]: An ordinary looking longsword lies here.

plain@rome.name: plain
plain@rome.examine:
Nothing is written on this scroll. Froboz kept it in his possession in case
he needed something to write on when inspiration hit him.
plain@rome.desc[0]: A plain scroll is lying on the ground.

spires@rome.name: spires
spires@rome.examine:
There are two tall spires on either side of the gate and are constantly manned
by the city guards.  They are made of stone and stand about 40 feet tall.

floor@rome.name: floor
floor@rome.examine:
Very expensive!  A lot of master craftsmen labored long and hard to produce
such a work of art.

longswordd@rome.name: longswordd
longswordd@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
longswordd@rome.desc[0]: An ordinary looking longsword lies here.

sandalsg@rome.name: sandalsg
sandalsg@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

walnut@rome.name: walnut
walnut@rome.examine:
The desk is made of solid walnut and gold inlay.  It is exquisitely carved
with superior craftsmanship, the likes of which has rarely been seen.  It was
probably brought to Rome from Gaul.

shieldh@rome.name: shieldh
shieldh@rome.examine: You see nothing special. Absolutely nothing.
shieldh@rome.desc[0]: A small, iron shield is gathering dust.

windows@rome.name: windows
windows@rome.examine:
They are intricate and the scenes that they depict cast honor on several of
the gods.

stairs@rome.name: stairs
stairs@rome.examine: The stairs are immaculately polished and made of white marble.

silver@rome.name: silver
silver@rome.desc[0]: A bracelet, made from silver and gold, has been carelessly left here.

slimea@rome.name: slimea
slimea@rome.examine:
Due to the availability of moisture and nutrients, a green, viscous slime has
grown and covered everything with a slippery coating.  It seems to go out of
its way to drip on you.

beakers@rome.name: beakers
beakers@rome.examine:
These are all tools of great power.  You cannot even begin to understand what
any of this stuff does.

road@rome.name: road
road@rome.examine: You can barely make out a storefront through the foliage.

ramar@rome.name: ramar
ramar@rome.examine:
It's hard to imagine the Romans speaking anything other than Latin, but this
anicent book makes the language of Ramar relatively easy to learn.  Soon you
feel you know Ramar like the back of your hand.
ramar@rome.desc[0]: The precursor to the modern Roman langauge of Ramar is here.

whistle@rome.name: whistle
whistle@rome.desc[0]: A coach's whistle has been left here.

broadswordq@rome.name: broadswordq
broadswordq@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
broadswordq@rome.desc[0]: An sharp looking broadsword lies here.

roll@rome.name: roll
roll@rome.examine:
Hey!!  This is first-class stuff!! - White Cloud brand with lotion.  The roll
is about half-used.

robe@rome.name: robe
robe@rome.examine:
This is Froboz's magical robe it looks rather stronger and protecting,
maybe even from magic.
robe@rome.desc[0]: Froboz's robe has been dropped here.

scorecards@rome.name: scorecards
scorecards@rome.examine:
The cards all have been filled in with the judges evaluations of today's
combatants.  It seems that Sparticus is having a good day.

vegetationc@rome.name: vegetationc
vegetationc@rome.examine:
The trees are old and tower hundreds of feet above the ground.  If you stand
still and listen carefully, you can hear the birds singing.

crowds@rome.name: crowds
crowds@rome.examine:
It looks like some kind of bizarre or festival is occurring to the west.  There
are hundreds of people of all classes shopping, talking or eating.

shieldm@rome.name: shieldm
shieldm@rome.examine: You see nothing special. Absolutely nothing.
shieldm@rome.desc[0]: A small, iron shield is gathering dust.

latumfus@rome.name: latumfus
latumfus@rome.desc[0]: There is a staff of Latumfus lying here on the ground.

fog@rome.name: fog
fog@rome.examine:
This is some really strange stuff!  You have never seen anything this color
before.  Your legs are totally obscured from the knee down.

papers@rome.name: papers
papers@rome.examine:
There are hundreds of pages of petitions, lawsuits and court orders sitting
on the desk.  One particularly interesting case involves a nobleman, a slave
and a roll of toilet paper.

fruit@rome.name: fruit
fruit@rome.examine:
The fruit trees, nourished by the fertile ground at the edge of the stream and
sustained by the brilliant sunshine, line the banks of the stream and are
laden with fruit.

workbench@rome.name: workbench
workbench@rome.examine:
These are all tools of great power.  You cannot even begin to understand what
any of this stuff does.

furnishings@rome.name: furnishings
furnishings@rome.examine:
The furniture that you see is very simple and plain.  It is made of rough hewn
wood and fastened together with nails.  It looks very uncomfortable.

ngate@rome.name: ngate
ngate@rome.examine: The gate is made of solid iron and is well maintained.

pearl@rome.name: pearl
pearl@rome.desc[0]: A key with a pearl handle is sitting on the ground.

opal@rome.name: opal
opal@rome.desc[0]: An opal key has been left here.

longswordf@rome.name: longswordf
longswordf@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
longswordf@rome.desc[0]: Another ordinary looking longsword lies here.

longswordm@rome.name: longswordm
longswordm@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
longswordm@rome.desc[0]: An ordinary looking longsword lies here.

doga@rome.name: doga
doga@rome.desc[0]: A hotdog loaded with chili and onions has been left here.

longsworde@rome.name: longsworde
longsworde@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
longsworde@rome.desc[0]: An ordinary looking longsword lies here.

landscape@rome.name: landscape
landscape@rome.examine:
You can see the entire city of Rome from here.  The buildings housing the
Roman government are to the east.  To the south east, off in the distance, is
the massive aquaduct and further in that direction lies the Mountain of the
Gods.

longswordb@rome.name: longswordb
longswordb@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
longswordb@rome.desc[0]: An ordinary looking longsword lies here.

longswordj@rome.name: longswordj
longswordj@rome.examine: It may be ordinary looking, but it's sharp enough for its purpose.
longswordj@rome.desc[0]: An ordinary looking longsword lies here.

pineapple@rome.name: pineapple
pineapple@rome.desc[0]: This pineapple will do just nicely for an afternoon snack.

shielde@rome.name: shielde
shielde@rome.examine: You see nothing special. Absolutely nothing.
shielde@rome.desc[0]: A small, iron shield is gathering dust.

egate@rome.name: egate
egate@rome.examine:
The gate is fabricated from iron and has been designed to keep intruders out
of the city.

mango@rome.name: mango
mango@rome.examine: Come on, eat it, if it's that delicious!
mango@rome.desc[0]: A delicious mango lies on the ground.

shieldk@rome.name: shieldk
shieldk@rome.examine: You see nothing special. Absolutely nothing.
shieldk@rome.desc[0]: A small, iron shield is gathering dust.

quenchedb@rome.name: quenchedb
quenchedb@rome.desc[0]: A very bloody quenched sword has been left here.

sandalsn@rome.name: sandalsn
sandalsn@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

plate@rome.name: plate
plate@rome.desc[0]: A piece of military combat plate has been left here.

tiberius@rome.name: tiberius
tiberius@rome.examine: The statue of Tiberius, made of iron, stands here.

shieldg@rome.name: shieldg
shieldg@rome.examine: You see nothing special. Absolutely nothing.
shieldg@rome.desc[0]: A small, iron shield is gathering dust.

shrubs@rome.name: shrubs
shrubs@rome.examine:
All of the plants, trees and shrubs are perfectly trimmed, without so much as
a dead leaf anywhere to be seen.  You welcome the shade that they give from
the harsh sun above.

bookcase@rome.name: bookcase
bookcase@rome.examine:
The books are very old and contain the wisdom of wise men from throughout the
entire Roman empire.  They appear to be collecting dust.

sandalse@rome.name: sandalse
sandalse@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

telescope@rome.name: telescope
telescope@rome.examine:
If it were operational, it would offer a spectacular view of the Mountain of
the Gods.  Unfortunately, it appears to have been vandalized.

vegetationa@rome.name: vegetationa
vegetationa@rome.examine:
All of the vegetation is lush, green and in full bloom.  You wish that you
could take the time to stop and enjoy it properly.

sandalsm@rome.name: sandalsm
sandalsm@rome.desc[0]: A pair of leather sandals has been dropped here.

rusty@rome.name: rusty
rusty@rome.desc[0]: There is a rusty key here.

leech@rome.name: leech
leech@rome.examine:
DISGUSTING!  Each is about the size of matchbox and very slimy.  You are VERY
glad that you have access to a cleric!

signcourt@rome.name: signcourt
signcourt@rome.examine:
There is a sign on the door that says:  MUNICIPAL COURT OF ROME.  It appears
to be open.

rome66@rome.title: Clay Road
rome66@rome.description: You travel upon an East-West road wide enough for 30 men to march abreast.

rome41@rome.title: The Aquaduct
rome41@rome.description:
You are in a massive stone structure that has been designed to channel water
into the city of Rome.  Due to the recent drought, the water level is low,
allowing passage without a boat.  The walls and floor are covered with algae
and &+Gslime&* producing treacherous footing conditions.  There are exits to the
north, south and east.

rome29@rome.title: The Great North Gate
rome29@rome.description:
This is the northern gateway to the city of Rome.  The huge gate appears to be
closed and locked against intrusion.  A large muddy &+yroad&* runs through the
&+Cgate&* and into the countryside.  Nero Drive runs south from here.

rome40@rome.title: Observation Lookout
rome40@rome.description:
You are on a platform overlooking a massive aquaduct.  There is a &+ctelescope
mounted to the railing that surrounds the area and you can hear the gurgle of
water as it is channeled into the city.  Off in the distance, you can see the
Mountain of the Gods.  There is a &+Csign&* mounted to the railing and a ramp leads
west.

rome4@rome.title: Southern Commoner's Seats
rome4@rome.description:
This is the southeastern part of the common seating areas.  The benches here
are made of stone and are probably centuries old.  A few scratches on one of
the benches catch your eye.  An acrid smell is coming from the east and a
tunnel leads off to the north.

rome20@rome.title: The Outhouse
rome20@rome.description:
PEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE-YEEEEEWWWWWWWW!!!!!  Boy does it stink in here!!!  You taste
bile in your mouth and your eyes begin to water.  As you wipe away your tears,
you see that this is a small room, in the far corner of which a &+yhole&* is dug.
The odor intensifies as you move closer and there is a &+Croll of toilet paper
sitting on the ground.  The only exit is to the west and your nose and stomach
are strongly suggesting that you use it.

rome19@rome.title: The Main Highway
rome19@rome.description:
This is a well built and heavily traveled road running from east to west, and
there is a large structure built entirely of stone to the north.

rome67@rome.title: End of the Clay Road
rome67@rome.description:
The mighty clay road turns into lesser, but still well traveled roads
here.  You feel a surge run through your body as you look East into the
desert that Rome has conquered.  This looks like a safe place to rest 
before starting into one of the power and dangerous cities ever to exist.

rome27@rome.title: Noble Estate
rome27@rome.description:
You are on the grounds of a nobleman's estate which is hundreds of times the
size and splendor of anything that a common citizen of Rome would ever hope
to own.  Everything is lush and green.  The grass is perfectly manicured and
the &+Gtrees&* are all bearing fruit.  Ornamental plants are in perfectly situated
to enhance and adorn the three statues of dedicated to gods Jupiter, Venus and
Neptune.  A tranquil path leads east and west, there is a paved road to the
north and an extravagant house lies to the south.

rome17@rome.title: The Lion Pit
rome17@rome.description:
Let's just say that your demise was not pretty and that the lions had a tasty
mid-day snack.....YOU.  I'm very sorry, but, you are really dead!!

rome64@rome.title: Before Rome
rome64@rome.description:
You travel upon an East-West road wide enough for 30 men to march
abreast.  It is packed hard through heavy use.  To the west stand the
Gates of Rome inviting you to enter and partake of all the glory and
splendor that is Rome.

rome15@rome.title: The Nobleman's Box
rome15@rome.description:
These are the 'better' seats used primarily by the upper class of Rome.  There
is a large seating area to the east and a staircase leading up here.  The view
of the chariot track is pretty good.

rome45@rome.title: Outside the Capitol
rome45@rome.description:
You stand on white marble steps that lead up and into the Capitol Building.
There are several &+Cstatues&*, none of any real significance, at the entrance to
the building.  The main entrance to the building is at the top of the &+Cstairs.

rome6@rome.title: Swords 'R  Us
rome6@rome.description:
Welcome to the weaponshop of Titus Andronicus!!  Rare halberds, whips, &+Cswords
and other instruments of death are proudly displayed on the walls and in
gleaming glass cases.  More common weapons are stacked like wood on the floor.
To the north you can barely make out a gate.  There is a very secure looking
door to the south.

rome37@rome.title: The Senate Chambers
rome37@rome.description:
This is the working room where elected senators from all over the empire
gather to advise the emperor.  An official seal of the emperor is hanging on
the far wall.  There is a wooden door to the north and a bronze door to the
east and doublehung door to the south.

rome32@rome.title: Town Square
rome32@rome.description:
You are standing in the middle of a large open area which is the common area
of Rome.  During the day, this place is alive with the hustle and bustle of
all of the citizens of Rome and everyone in the city is sure to stop by at
some time or another.  There are several street &+Yvendors&* peddling their wares
and the overall atmosphere is carnival-like in nature.  To the southeast, off
in the distance, you can see the &+Baquaduct&* and the buildings of the Roman
government lie to the northwest.  Nero Drive leads north and south from here
and Clay Avenue runs east.

rome11@rome.title: The First-Aid Station
rome11@rome.description:
This is the place to come to if one is overcome by the heat and gore.  (Or if
a lion gets loose.)  You see a jar of live &+Rleeches&* and other barbaric medical
apparatus lying about here.  From the west comes the roar of the crowd, and a
hall leads east.  The doctor will be with you shortly.

rome3@rome.title: West Side Commoner's Seating Area
rome3@rome.description:
This is the western side commoner's seating area.  There are row upon row 
of rough wooden benches bolted to the floor.  There is stadium garbage 
everywhere and the smell makes you want to puke.  Stairs lead up to 
Caesar's private box, a small ramp leads down to the playing field and a 
hallway leads south.

rome30@rome.title: Nero Drive
rome30@rome.description:
You are walking on a paved road that runs south through the city of Rome.  A
great gate is directly north of here.  The Roman citizens are very friendly
and tip their hats or say hello as you pass.

rome63@rome.title: The General Store
rome63@rome.description:
You are standing in the only general store of Rome.  The walls and shelves
are covered with all of the various items required by Roman citizens and
stalwart mudders.  Clay Avenue lies to the south.

rome7@rome.title: The Back Room
rome7@rome.description:
If you thought that there were a lot of &+Cweapons&* in the front of the store,
you haven't seen anything yet!!  There is barely enough room to walk amongst
the crates of armor and swords.  No wonder Rome will stand for a thousand
years.  The only exit is through a door to the north.

rome61@rome.title: The Torture Chamber
rome61@rome.description:
You are standing in a very small room in which there are many tools designed
specifically for inflicting pain and suffering.  Some of them are familiar,
such as the rack and the iron maidens.  Others, you have never seen before
and they make you wonder about the kind of sadistic mind that dreamt them up.
The only exit is to the west.

rome42@rome.title: The Mage's Shop
rome42@rome.description:
You are standing in the mage's shop.  Magical ointments, charms and potions
are sitting on shelves and behind a glass counter.  There is a dense neon
&+Bblue fog&* hugging the floor here, making it impossible to see below your knees.
You suddenly hear muttering coming from the back room, possibly from ....
KKKKKAAAAAAAABBBBOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!!!!!!
You are deafened by the noise from a tremendous explosion and the concussion
from the blast staggers you!  The shopkeeper seems to pay no heed to this.
The door to the back room opens and an older man, wearing a pointed hat, whose
face is smudged with soot, sticks his head out.  'Is everyone alright?  Sorry
about that.  I was testing a new mage's spell.  I'll try to give advance notice
next time,' he says.  The door then closes.

rome16@rome.title: Race Track
rome16@rome.description:
This is a hard dirt track about a quarter of a mile long.  There are hoof
prints everywhere, and you see a large cloud of dust approaching.  You had
better move before you get run over.  A small tunnel leads west, you can see
the crowd to the east.  You can hear loud snarls and roars coming from below.

rome54@rome.title: The Aquaduct
rome54@rome.description:
You are in a massive stone structure that has been designed to channel water
into the city of Rome.  Due to the recent drought, the water level is low,
allowing passage without a boat.  The walls and floor are covered with algae
and slime, producing treacherous footing conditions.  There are exits in all
four cardinal directions.

rome31@rome.title: Nero Drive
rome31@rome.description:
You are walking on a great paved road that runs north and south through the
city.  People are hurrying from one place to another, but always stop to say
hello.  Most of the people are either coming from or going to the town square.
Nero Drive continues to the north, and you can see a large open area to the
south.

rome55@rome.title: Judge's Chambers
rome55@rome.description:
You are in a small room that is filled with legal &+Rtomes&*.  There is a small
desk here, literally buried under legal &+Cdocuments&*.  There is also a small
window overlooking the northern part of the city.

rome53@rome.title: The Aquaduct
rome53@rome.description:
You are in a massive stone structure that has been designed to channel water
into the city of Rome.  Due to the recent drought, the water level is low,
allowing passage without a boat.  The walls and floor are covered with algae
and slime, producing treacherous footing conditions.  There are exits in all
four cardinal directions.

rome8@rome.title: Peanut Heaven
rome8@rome.description:
You are now so high up that you begin to feel lightheaded and your nose feels
like it is going to start bleeding.  There aren't even benches to sit on here;
just bare dirty stone.  The view of the surrounding &+gcountry&* is spectacular.
Unfortunately you can barely see the playing field.  There is a set of steps
here, leading down.

rome24@rome.title: East Entrance to Coliseum
rome24@rome.description:
You are standing at the east entrance to the Coliseum.  There are people
everywhere, apparently in a mad rush to get in.  A &+Cstatue of Tiberius&*, an
emperor of a time long since passed, stands here looking out over the crowd.
There is a passage to the north, the ticket booth is to the south and a gate
opening to the city lies to the east.

rome58@rome.title: The Valley of the Gods
rome58@rome.description:
You stand in a tranquil valley at the base of a large mountain.  A quiet
&+Bstream&* full of &+Cfish&*, with &+Rfruit&* trees growing along its banks, winds its way 
peacefully through the valley and enters a large stone structure that lies 
to the west.  There are birds singing and every now and then a ripple breaks 
the surface of the stream.  You can see a path leading up, through the trees.
There is a small hole, from which you can hear rushing water, to the north.

rome44@rome.title: The Entrance Foyer
rome44@rome.description:
You have just entered the main government building of the Roman Empire and are
standing in a massive room with an elaborately decorated domed roof.  There
are many people here--messengers and senators being the most numerous.  There
is a large, ornate door to the west, a hallway leads north and marble stairs
that lead out of the building are to the south.

rome59@rome.title: A Mountain Path
rome59@rome.description:
You are standing on a path that leads up through a stand of large &+Gtrees.
Everything is green and it seems like eternal spring - this is Mother Nature
at her finest.  It is possible to descend into a tranquil valley from here.

rome52@rome.title: A Mountain Path
rome52@rome.description:
You stand on a small &+ytrail&* that leads up and down.  It has recently been
raining and there are small puddles everywhere.  You are just below the
clouds and the view of the surrounding countryside is breathtaking.

rome60@rome.title: The Holding Cells
rome60@rome.description:
You are standing in the holding &+Bcell&* area, just off of the courtroom.  Those
who are recently convicted of serious crimes are brought here, pending torture
and execution.  The courtroom lies to the north and another exit goes east.

rome46@rome.title: Clay Avenue
rome46@rome.description:
You are standing on a wide, heavily traveled road that runs east and west
through the heart of the city.  There are marble steps leading up.  To the
south, off in the distance, you can see a large &+Cstone structure&* and a &+ymountain
that is partially obscured by the haze.  There is a general store to the north.

rome43@rome.title: The Waiting Room
rome43@rome.description:
You are standing in a very large room with a high ceiling and there are a few
people waiting here to see the emperor on urgent matters. The master scheduler
tells you to have a seat and sends a page to inform his highness of your
arrival.  There are large doors to the east and a gold plated door to the west
along with an exit leads south to the foyer. There is a &+Csign&* here.

rome39@rome.title: Clay Avenue
rome39@rome.description:
You are on a wide well traveled road running east and west through the heart
of Rome.  There are large &+Rcrowds&* of people to the west and the road continues
to the east.  The aquaduct is directly south of here.

rome47@rome.title: The Summit of The Mountain of the Gods
rome47@rome.description:
You are at the summit of a very high mountain and are standing above the
clouds.  The sun is shining brilliantly here and the clouds below look like
balls of cotton.  The path that you have been walking on is damp and the scent
of lilac is in the air.

rome9@rome.title: The Practice and Warm-up Area
rome9@rome.description:
There are many gladiators, chariot drivers and their coaches here, warming up
in preparation for the games.  The dust rising from the parched earth makes
you want to sneeze.  A short tunnel leads east and the thunder of pounding
hooves and the clash of weapons can be heard coming from the south.

rome38@rome.title: The House of Commons
rome38@rome.description:
This is the lower house of the advising body to the emperor.  Common men from
all parts of Rome work here to further assist the senators in advising the
emperor on critical matters of state.  The seal of the emperor is painted on
the far wall.  The only exit is to the north.

rome22@rome.title: The Common Seating
rome22@rome.description:
This is where many of the common Roman citizens are seated during the games.
These are the cheapest seats in the house, as glare from the sun is usually a
problem during the afternoon.  Like the other common seating areas, this place
could stand extensive renovation and a thorough cleaning.  This area extends
to the south and a much more elegant seating area can be seen to the west.

rome57@rome.title: The Aquaduct
rome57@rome.description:
You are in a massive stone structure that has been designed to channel water
into the city of Rome.  Due to a recent drought, the water level is low,
allowing passage without a boat.  The walls and floor are covered with algae
and slime, producing treacherous footing conditions.  A valley lies to the
south and the other cardinal directions lead further into the aqueduct.

rome34@rome.title: Nero Drive
rome34@rome.description:
This is a busy paved road that runs north through the city.  The people of
Rome are very friendly and say hello as you pass.  A gate leading out of the
city lies to the south and a small path goes west towards a nobleman's estate.
To the east, off in the distance, lies the great mountain.  It is rumored that
the gods watch over and protect the empire from there.

rome68@rome.title: Rome Central Station
rome68@rome.description:
You are standing on a hastily constructed train platform about 70 meters long
and several meters wide.  There are train tracks to your east and west.  The
station exit is to the south.

rome26@rome.title: Paved Road
rome26@rome.description:
You are on a paved road that runs east to west.  You can see an elaborate
looking estate to the south and to the north-west, off in the distance, you
can see a very large stone &+cstructure.

rome35@rome.title: The South Gate
rome35@rome.description:
This is the southern gateway to the city of Rome.  The bronze &+ygate&* is closed
and locked.  Looking through the bars, you see a heavily traveled road leading
out of the city.  Nero Drive starts here and runs north and a wizard's shop
lies to the east.

rome25@rome.title: At the Ticket Booth
rome25@rome.description:
People are standing in long lines here, waiting to buy tickets.  There are
3 vendors working furiously, but hopelessly backed up.  Ticket stubs litter
the ground and you can see that the people are getting very impatient.  There
is a large, open &+Gcashbox&* here.  Main entrances to the Coliseum are to the north
and west.

rome14@rome.title: The Bedchamber
rome14@rome.description:
This is the bedroom.  There is a hard and lumpy bed in the far corner.  It
looks like the commoner's wife has been shirking her duties lately, as there
is a big pile of soiled &+ylaundry&* here.  The only way out is from where you
came.

rome12@rome.title: A Dirt Road
rome12@rome.description:
You are on a parched and dusty rural road which runs east and west.  There is
a structure lying to the south.

rome48@rome.title: The Aqueduct
rome48@rome.description:
You are in a massive stone structure that has been designed to channel water
into the city of Rome.  Due to the recent drought, the water level is low,
allowing passage without a boat.  The walls and floor are covered with algae
and slime, producing treacherous footing conditions.  There are exits in all
four cardinal directions.

rome49@rome.title: Froboz's Workshop
rome49@rome.description:
You are standing in the workshop of Froboz the Great, the most powerful and
famous mage that Rome has ever known.  Workbenches line the walls and are
covered with various test &+Ctubes, beakers, petri dishes&* and crucibles and there
is an odor in here that can best be described as a combination of old sweat
socks and burning tires.  The only exit is back through the door through which
you came.  In the middle of the room, you see a pile of ashes that looks like
it once was a body and Froboz is busy making adjustments on a new type of
magic wand .... possibly the one responsible for the explosion a few minutes
ago.  He removes a jeweler's loupe from his eye as he turns around.  'How in
the name of Merlin did you get in here??!!' he asks.  'Oh, nevermind!  Since
you are here, you can serve as witnesses to the final test of the new mage's
spell:  'ectowatt'.'  With this he makes a magical gesture and the Paladin
Knight appears.  Crossing his fingers, Froboz waves the wand his direction and
what happens next is incredible!  The Paladin is enveloped in what appears to
be a small, well contained, thermonuclear explosion.  When the smoke clears
you can see that the Paladin and all of equipment has been reduced to a large
pile of flaming &+Rcinders&*.  Froboz throws his head back and cackles with insane
glee.  'Now, my young friends, what can I do for you?' he asks.

rome36@rome.title: The Emperor's Private Office
rome36@rome.description:
You are standing in the emperor's private office.  The room is richly
furnished with the finest of the loot brought back from conquests of far
away lands.  There is a massive, intricately carved &+ydesk&* here, upon which
are important &+Cdocuments&*, decrees and other paperwork involved in running the
empire.  On the far wall, there is a marble &+ybookcase&* that is well stocked
with the works of Homer, Plato, Socrates and other wise men.  Further, it
seems that the current emperor likes &+Yflowers&* as there are many potted and cut
specimens throughout the room.  There is a french door leading to the waiting
room and a wooden door to the south.

rome50@rome.title: The Courtroom
rome50@rome.description:
You stand inside of a large courtroom in which common civil disputes and
criminal matters are decided.  There is a judge's bench and a witness stand
on the far side of the room and a jury's box along side.  The emperor's &+Mseal
is prominently displayed on the wall behind the judge's &+ystand&*, reminding all
who enter that he is an extension of his highness.  There is a door, possibly
leading to the judge's chambers, to the east and the waiting room is to the
west.

rome18@rome.title: South Entrance to the Coliseum
rome18@rome.description:
You are standing at the south entrance to the Coliseum.  There are citizens of
Rome everywhere, apparently in a mad rush to get in.  A &+Cstatue of Caligula&* the
Mad Emperor overlooks the area.  There are long &+Ylines&* of people standing to the
east, an acrid smell is coming from the west and a busy road lies to the south.

rome2@rome.title: Caesar's Private Box
rome2@rome.description:
This is the best view in the house!  You can see gladiators fighting or the
chariot races with an unobstructed view.  The seats are upholstered in red
velvet and are in top-notch condition.  There is a rickety ladder leading
up and a marble staircase leading down.

rome21@rome.title: The Slave Quarters
rome21@rome.description:
This is where the slaves sleep.  There are hard boards set out for use as beds
and not much else.  The only exit is to the north.

rome65@rome.title: Clay Road
rome65@rome.description:
You travel upon an East-West road wide enough for 30 men to march
abreast.  It is packed hard through heavy use.  To the west, you eyes
catch the splendors of a mighty city.  North of here, there is a large 
concrete landing pad.

rome1@rome.title: The Judging Booth
rome1@rome.description:
You stand in the midst of a small room with windows on the east and south 
walls.  These windows provide a complete view of the competition fields. 
There are several &+Cscorecards, pencils&* and other items that are used by the 
judges sitting on a table.  The only exit is a trapdoor leading down.

rome51@rome.title: The East Gate of Rome
rome51@rome.description:
You are standing inside of the eastern gate of Rome.  There are two tall
&+Mspires&* built into the city wall, from which the guards can see the whole
eastern side of the city.  The &+ygate&* is currently open and to the east,
there is a heavily used road, made of packed clay, that leads out of Rome.
Another road leads westward into the city.

rome13@rome.title: The Commoner's House
rome13@rome.description:
You are standing in the main living quarters of a common Roman citizen.  The
&+Mfurnishings&* are sparse and it is warm here.  A putrid odor is coming from the
east and passages lead north and south.

rome33@rome.title: Nero Drive
rome33@rome.description:
You are walking on a paved road that runs north and south through the city of
Rome.  There are many people here, as polite as always.  Most of them are
either coming from or going to the town square which lies to the north.  Nero
Drive continues to the south.  There is an observation area overlooking the
aqueduct to the east and a paved road leads west.

rome5@rome.title: The Abandoned Gate
rome5@rome.description:
This used to be a gateway to and from western Rome.  There is an iron &+ygate
blocking your way.  Judging by the amount of rust and foliage growing on the
bars, it hasn't been open for years.  Looking through the gate at the barren
landscape that lies beyond, you can see why.  A dirt &+yroad&* leads off to the
east, and a store is directly south.

rome56@rome.title: A Mountain Path
rome56@rome.description:
You are standing on a small &+ytrail&* that leads through a grove of &+Gtrees&*.  Every
thing is lush and green here and it appears to have been raining recently.
'This would be an ideal place for a picnic,' you think to yourself.

rome10@rome.title: The Jousting Arena
rome10@rome.description:
This is a wide open grassy plane....LOOK OUT!!!!  You are almost skewered by a
gladiator's lance as he makes his charge.  A practicing area is due north and
you can hear loud snarls and roars from below.

rome28@rome.title: An Opulent House
rome28@rome.description:
You stand in a house, the size and splendor of which almost defies the
imagination.  The &+Cfloor&* is done with hand crafted marble tile with silver
and jeweled inlays.  The light coming through the exquisitely crafted stained
glass &+Cwindows&* bathes the room in splendor and the &+Bfurniture&* looks as though it
was made by master craftsmen from all over the empire.  A path through the
estate is north of here.

rome23@rome.title: The Common Seating
rome23@rome.description:
This is where many of the common Roman citizens are seated during the games.
Like the other commoners' areas in the coliseum, it could use extensive
renovation and cleaning.  This area extends to the north and lots of noise can
be heard coming from the south.

rome62@rome.title: The Roman Bakery
rome62@rome.description:
You are standing in the bakery of Rome and your mouth waters at the delicious
aromas wafting from the kitchen.  The only exit is to the east.

venus@rome.name: Venus
venus@rome.description: Venus, the god of beauty and knowledge, is resting here.

cominius@rome.name: Cominius
cominius@rome.description: A citizen of Rome is standing here.

junius@rome.name: Junius
junius@rome.examine: You see a small, dirty man who doesn't look very healthy.
junius@rome.description: A poor peddler is standing here, trying to support his meager existence.

bailiff@rome.name: bailiff
bailiff@rome.description: The bailiff stands here, keeping order in the courtroom.

senator@rome.name: senator
senator@rome.description: The senator is here, waiting for debate to begin.

slimeball@rome.name: slimeball
slimeball@rome.examine: There is a green ball of slime oozing from the coating on the walls.
slimeball@rome.description: There is a slippery slimeball here.

boetius@rome.name: Boetius
boetius@rome.examine: You see a small, dirty man who doesn't look very healthy.
boetius@rome.description: A fat peddler is standing here, trying to support his meager(?) existence.

quintus@rome.name: Quintus
quintus@rome.examine: The spectator is filthy, half drunk and screaming his head off.
quintus@rome.description: A drunken spectator is screaming his head off.

scheduler@rome.name: scheduler
scheduler@rome.description: The master scheduler is here, writing in an appointment book.

executioner@rome.name: executioner
executioner@rome.examine:
You see a burly man who is wearin a black hood that obscures his face.  He
has a very sadistic attitude and clearly loves his work.
executioner@rome.description: The executioner stands here, waiting to torture some sorry soul.

marcia@rome.name: Marcia
marcia@rome.examine: You see a small, dirty woman who doesn't look very healthy.
marcia@rome.description: A small peddler is standing here, trying to support her meager existence.

gateguard_4@rome.name: gateguard_4
gateguard_4@rome.examine: You see a strong, loyal public defender.
gateguard_4@rome.description: A gateguard stands here, tending the gate.

marcus@rome.name: Marcus
marcus@rome.description: Marcus Dupus is trying to find out how he can install Turbo Pascal.

jupiter@rome.name: Jupiter
jupiter@rome.description: Jupiter, King of the Gods, is resting here.

nobleman@rome.name: nobleman
nobleman@rome.examine:
The nobleman is dressed in fine clothes and jewelry and has a very snobbish
attitude.  While he is getting old and his hair and beard are streaked with
gray, he is by no means an easy target.
nobleman@rome.description: The nobleman stands here looking aloof.

demetrius@rome.name: Demetrius
demetrius@rome.examine: The spectator is filthy, half drunk and screaming his head off.
demetrius@rome.description: A filthy spectator is here watching the games.

coach@rome.name: coach
coach@rome.description: There is a coach standing here, going over last minute strategy.

sicinius@rome.name: Sicinius
sicinius@rome.examine:
The vendor is a scruffy looking man who isn't afraid of a fight and looks like
he's had just about enough of smart-mouthed spectators.
sicinius@rome.description: A stadium vendor is walking here, selling ice cream and candy bars.

tonnus@rome.name: Tonnus
tonnus@rome.description:
Tonnus Rooverus, public enemy no. 1, is sneaking around, trying
to take something away from you.

balorus@rome.name: Balorus
balorus@rome.examine: The spectator is filthy, half drunk and screaming his head off.
balorus@rome.description: A spectator is here watching the games.

bassianus@rome.name: Bassianus
bassianus@rome.examine: The spectator is filthy, half drunk and screaming his head off.
bassianus@rome.description: A spectator is here watching the games.

adrianus@rome.name: Adrianus
adrianus@rome.examine: You see a member of one of the emperor's elite legions.  He looks VERY strong.
adrianus@rome.description: A soldier on leave is walking around.

nurse@rome.name: nurse
nurse@rome.examine:
The nurse is a very beautiful young lady who is about 22 years old.  She has
deep brown eyes and shoulder-length chestnut hair.  Her body is perfectly 
proportioned and she stands about five feet tall.
nurse@rome.description: There is a beautiful nurse standing here.

gateguard_2@rome.name: gateguard_2
gateguard_2@rome.examine: You see a strong, loyal public defender.
gateguard_2@rome.description: A gateguard stands here, tending the gate.

defendant@rome.name: defendant
defendant@rome.description: A defendant stands here, pleading her case.

velutus@rome.name: Velutus
velutus@rome.examine:
The bodyguard is dressed in the finest of armor and wields only the
deadliest of weapons.  He is very strong and would put up one hell of a
fight.
velutus@rome.description: There is a royal bodyguard here, ready to die for the emperor, if necessary.

lucius@rome.name: Lucius
lucius@rome.examine: A tall grocer, who moves two 200 pounds bag of flour around on his shoulders.
lucius@rome.description:
Lucius the Grocer stands at the counter, with a slightly impatient look
on his face.

gateguard_1@rome.name: gateguard_1
gateguard_1@rome.examine: You see a strong, loyal public defender.
gateguard_1@rome.description: A gateguard stands here, tending the gate.

gladiator@rome.name: gladiator
gladiator@rome.examine:
A well muscled man who is very heavily armored and armed to the teeth.  He
lives for combat.
gladiator@rome.description: There is a gladiator standing here.

driver@rome.name: driver
driver@rome.examine:
You see a very slight and small individual whose whole life is centered around
nothing but horses and speed.
driver@rome.description: There is a chariot driver here.

gateguard_3@rome.name: gateguard_3
gateguard_3@rome.examine: You see a strong, loyal public defender.
gateguard_3@rome.description: A gateguard stands here, tending the gate.

lucretia@rome.name: Lucretia
lucretia@rome.examine:
A very pretty young woman who was captured instead of being killed when the
Roman legions subjugated her land.
lucretia@rome.description: A slave stands here waiting for her master.

ventidius@rome.name: Ventidius
ventidius@rome.examine:
A fat, nice looking baker. But you can see that he has many scars on his
body.
ventidius@rome.description: The Baker looks at you calmly, wiping flour from his face with one hand.

aemilius@rome.name: Aemilius
aemilius@rome.examine: You see a member of one of the emperor's elite legions.  He looks VERY strong.
aemilius@rome.description: A soldier on leave is looking for a nice pub to spend his pay in.

lucullus@rome.name: Lucullus
lucullus@rome.description: A citizen of Rome is standing here.

mars@rome.name: Mars
mars@rome.description: Mars, the god of war and state, is here.

froboz@rome.name: Froboz
froboz@rome.examine:
You see a middle-aged man who's knowledge of magic, both offensive and 
defensive, is legendary.  He literally glows with a pink aura.
froboz@rome.description: Froboz the wizard is standing here, working on a new spell.

doctor@rome.name: doctor
doctor@rome.examine:
You see a young man, just out of med school, wearing a white coat and using
a stethoscope.

mercury@rome.name: Mercury
mercury@rome.description: Mercury, the messenger of the gods, is standing here.

judge@rome.name: judge
judge@rome.description: A judge is standing here, reading a case.

plaintiff@rome.name: plaintiff
plaintiff@rome.description: The plaintiff stands here, pleading his case.

aufidius@rome.name: Aufidius
aufidius@rome.examine:
The vendor is a scruffy looking man who isn't afraid of a fight and looks like
he's had just about enough of smart-mouthed spectators.
aufidius@rome.description: A stadium vendor is walking here, selling overpriced hotdogs and beer.

sempronius@rome.name: Sempronius
sempronius@rome.examine: You see a member of one of the emperor's elite legions.  He looks VERY strong.
sempronius@rome.description: A soldier on leave is walking around.

tullus@rome.name: Tullus
tullus@rome.description: A ticket master is here, looking at you expectantly.

lavinia@rome.name: Lavinia
lavinia@rome.examine:
A very pretty young woman who was captured instead of being killed when the
Roman legions subjugated her land.
lavinia@rome.description: A slave stands here, wishing that she was free.

slime@rome.name: slime
slime@rome.examine: There is a green ball of slime oozing from the coating on the walls.
slime@rome.description: There is a slippery slimeball here.

marcius@rome.name: Marcius
marcius@rome.examine: You see a small, dirty man who doesn't look very healthy.
marcius@rome.description: A haggard peddler is standing here, trying to support his meager existence.

page@rome.name: page
page@rome.examine:
You see a young boy who looks very strong and very fast.  He has the look of
a scholar about him.
page@rome.description: A page stands here, waiting to run an errand.

trebonius@rome.name: Trebonius
trebonius@rome.description: A citizen of Rome is here.

menenius@rome.name: Menenius
menenius@rome.examine:
The shopkeeper is an older man in his middle to late fifties and looks like
he enjoys the quiet life.  There is a long scar running from the edge of his
mouth to his right ear, making it look like he is always smiling.
menenius@rome.description: Menenius, Froboz's shopkeeper is here, minding the store.

dominius@rome.name: Dominius
dominius@rome.description: A citizen of Rome is standing here.

valentine@rome.name: Valentine
valentine@rome.examine:
A very pretty young woman who was captured instead of being killed when the
Roman legions subjugated her land.
valentine@rome.description: A slave stands here, wishing that she was free.

adjudicator@rome.name: adjudicator
adjudicator@rome.examine:
The adjudicator is a retired gladiator and scars cover all exposed parts of his
body.  Although he is getting on in years, he remains healthy and fit.
adjudicator@rome.description: The adjudicator is watching the games intently.

ball@rome.name: ball
ball@rome.examine: There is a green ball of slime oozing from the coating on the walls.
ball@rome.description: There is a slippery slimeball here.

scorekeeper@rome.name: scorekeeper
scorekeeper@rome.examine:
The scorekeeper is a young man of about 25 years of age and is very intently
studying his clipboard.
scorekeeper@rome.description: A scorekeeper has one eye on his stopwatch and the other on a clipboard.

marullus@rome.name: Marullus
marullus@rome.examine: You see a member of one of the emperor's elite legions.  He looks VERY strong.
marullus@rome.description: A soldier on leave is walking around.

caesar@rome.name: Caesar
caesar@rome.examine:
You see a man who is dressed in the finest of clothes, has eaten the best of
foods and lived in the most opulent palace that Rome has ever known.
caesar@rome.description: Julius Caesar, the emperor of Rome is sitting here.

colonius@rome.name: Colonius
colonius@rome.examine: You see a small, dirty man who doesn't look very healthy.
colonius@rome.description: A poor peddler is standing here, trying to support his meager existence.

saturninus@rome.name: Saturninus
saturninus@rome.examine: The spectator is filthy, half drunk and screaming his head off.
saturninus@rome.description: A spectator is here watching the games.

titus@rome.name: Titus
titus@rome.description: Titus Andronicus is standing here, polishing a few swords.

martius@rome.name: Martius
martius@rome.examine: You see a member of one of the emperor's elite legions.  He looks VERY strong.
martius@rome.description: A soldier on leave is wandering around.

lartius@rome.name: Lartius
lartius@rome.examine:
The shopkeeper is an older man in his middle to late fifties and looks like
he enjoys the quiet life.  There is a long scar running from the edge of his
mouth to his right ear, making it look like he is always smiling.
lartius@rome.description: Lartius, Titus's shopkeeper, is here, minding the store.
